chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevon J. Winn

records.addlTxt:
NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Trevon J. Winn. Defendant Trevon J. Winn in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Gardner states that she just got an offer and needs to discuss it with the DE.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, Trevon J. Winn, appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:25 PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on 8-25-22 @930am  before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.   Bond continued. ec

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.   DE appears pro se.       Clerk JT  Minutes:   DE appears at 925am.  Court vacates warrant and reinstates previous bond.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.

Defendant Trevon J. Winn not in court.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  No appearance by the DE..  Court forfeits bond and issues bench warrant in the amount of $1500 cash.
KPD 2022-00025841   Bench warrant      MUST POST OR HOLD FOR COURT
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms.   *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No drug paraphenalia

01:56 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.. $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
